snippet: A study by the Agriculture Department found that food stamps, one of the country’s largest social safety net programs, reduced the poverty rate substantially during the recession.
abstract: Study by the Agriculture Department finds that food stamps, one of the country’s largest social safety net programs, reduced the poverty rate by nearly 8 percent in 2009, a significant impact for a social program whose effects often go unnoticed by policy makers.
lead_paragraph: A study by the Agriculture Department found that food stamps, one of the country’s largest social safety net programs, reduced the poverty rate substantially during the recession.

headline.seo: Food Stamp Program Helping Reduce Poverty
headline.main: Food Stamps Helped Reduce Poverty Rate, Study Finds
headline.print_headline: Food Stamps Helped Reduce Poverty Rate, Study Finds
